arguments.description: The frequency of the tune.
arguments.name: freq

arguments.description: The amplitude of the tune.
arguments.name: amp

generate.shortDescription: Generates a tune from wave, frequency, and amplitude

arguments.description: The sound effect data.
arguments.name: sfx

arguments.description: A channel from 0 to 3.
arguments.name: chn

play.shortDescription: Plays a sound effect over a channel.

Audio.name: Audio
Audio.shortDescription: Allows the generation of chiptune audio.

BIOS.fullDescription:
Provides APIs to get information about the peripherals, and their methods, are the direct or indirect.

Also gives info about LIKO-12's version, and previous version when updated from an old one (only the first boot with the new version).
Starting with LIKO-12 0.9.0, It also gives the .love of LIKO-12.

HandledAPIS.extra:
The peripherals handled APIS is a table where the keys and values are:
- **Keys**: The mount name.
- **Values**: The peripheral methods (functions).
notes:
The HandledAPIS table is passed to the operating system's `boot.lua` as an argument:
```lua
--In C:/boot.lua
local HandledAPIS = ...
```
HandledAPIS.shortDescription: Returns the handled peripherals APIS, that can be used directly.

arguments.description: The peripheral mount name.
arguments.name: mountName

PeripheralFunctions.extra:
The peripheral functions list is a table where the keys and values are:
- **Keys**: The function/method name.
- **Values**: The function/method type (`"Direct"` or `"Yield"`).
notes:
It's good to know if a method/function is a yield or direct one:
- **Direct Methods** are called directly, _fast_.
- **Yielding Methods** requires a coroutine yield, _slow_.
PeripheralFunctions.shortDescription: Returns the list of available peripheral functions, and their type (Direct,Yield).

Peripherals.extra:
The peripherals list is a table where the keys and values are:
- **Keys**: The mount name.
- **Values**: The peripheral type.
Peripherals.shortDescription: Returns a list of mounted peripherals and their types.

notes: `LIKO-12_Source.love` is created at the first boot whenever a different LIKO-12 version is used, with the message `Generating internal file...` shown.

returns.description: The file data of LIKO-12's source code .love file.
returns.name: LIKO_SRC

notes: The `LIKO_Old` value is only provided when LIKO-12 boots for the __first time__ with the new version.

returns.description: The previous installed LIKO-12's version string (ex: `0.8.0_PRE`).
returns.name: LIKO_Old

returns.description: True when this is the first boot of LIKO-12 ever.
returns.name: FirstBoot

isFirstBoot.shortDescription: Tells if this is the first boot of LIKO-12 ever.

BIOS.name: Basic Integrated Operating System

arguments.description: The time passed since the previous `update` triggered, measured in seconds.
arguments.name: dt

notes: `update` is triggered 60 times a second for most of the devices, but that depends on the screen refresh rate, so it can be more or less!
`update` can be triggered for over than 2000 times a second if the vsync of the GPU was disabled due to user's configuration!
update.shortDescription: Triggered almost every frame, with the delta-time between each called passed in.

isMobile.shortDescription: Returns true if LIKO-12 is running on a mobile device (Android or iOS).

arguments.description: The directory to open in the HOST file explorer.
arguments.name: dir

openAppdata.longDescription:
Opens a specific directory inside the LIKO-12 appdata folder using the HOST file explorer.

In order to show a folder inside the virtual drives open `/drives/[driveName]/...`.
openAppdata.shortDescription: Opens a specific directory inside the LIKO-12 appdata folder using the HOST file explorer.

pullEvent.longDescription:
This function is used internally by DiskOS to run the default event loop, which calls the callback functions that start by `_` like `_update` and `_mousepressed`, etc..

Events in LIKO-12 may be pulled directly, or pulled from a stack if there are already, the stack may fill up when CPU `sleep()` or GPU `flip()` are called.

returns.description: The event name, can be any of the callbacks names without the "_" at the start.
returns.name: event

pullEvent.shortDescription: Pulls an event from the events stack.

returns.description: The event name, can be any of the callbacks names without the "_" at the start.
returns.name: event

rawPullEvent.shortDescription: Pulls a new event directly, returns it and stores it in the events stack, used by DiskOS to handle the `escape` key.

usages.name: Soft Reboot:
usages.shortDescription: Soft reboots LIKO-12 by doing an internal trick to reload the BIOS and bootup again, will leave some garbage that will be cleaned automatically by the Lua garbage collector.

usages.name: Hard Reboot:
usages.shortDescription: Hard reboots LIKO-12 by reinitializing the LÃ–VE engine, will clear the whole Lua state, and re-create the window.

arguments.description: The callback function. The x, y coord and color are passed. And the function can return the new pixel color, otherwise the pixel color will stay the same.

notes: The function that's passed as an argument will be called for every pixel in the image, starting with the top-left one, and going in horizental lines.

isKDown.longDescription:
Checks whether a certain key is down.

Check [Enums/KeyConstants](/Documentation/Enums/KeyConstants.md).

returns.description: True if any supplied key is down, false if not.
returns.name: down

isKDown.shortDescription: Checks whether a certain key is down.

keyrepeat.longDescription:
Enables or disables key repeat. It is disabled by default.

The interval between repeats depends on the user's system settings.

**Note:** It's better to do `if isrepeat then return true end` than calling this function.

arguments.description: Whether repeat keypress events should be enabled when a key is held down.
arguments.name: state

usages.name: Get the current key repeat state:

returns.description: Whether repeat keypress events should be enabled when a key is held down.
returns.name: state

arguments.description: The key to get the scancode from.
arguments.name: key

keytoscancode.longDescription:
Gets the hardware scancode corresponding to the given key.

Unlike key constants, Scancodes are keyboard layout-independent. For example the scancode "w" will be generated if the key in the same place as the "w" key on an American keyboard is pressed, no matter what the key is labelled or what the user's operating system settings are.

Scancodes are useful for creating default controls that have the same physical locations on on all systems.

Check [Enums/Scancodes](/Documentation/Enums/Scancodes.md) and [Enums/KeyConstants](/Documentation/Enums/KeyConstants.md).

returns.description: The scancode corresponding to the given key, or "unknown" if the given key has no known physical representation on the current system.
returns.name: scancode

keytoscancode.shortDescription: Gets the hardware scancode corresponding to the given key.

arguments.description: The scancode to get the key from.
arguments.name: scancode

scancodetokey.longDescription:
Gets the key corresponding to the given hardware scancode.

Unlike key constants, Scancodes are keyboard layout-independent. For example the scancode "w" will be generated if the key in the same place as the "w" key on an American keyboard is pressed, no matter what the key is labelled or what the user's operating system settings are.

Scancodes are useful for creating default controls that have the same physical locations on on all systems.

Check [Enums/Scancodes](/Documentation/Enums/Scancodes.md) and [Enums/KeyConstants](/Documentation/Enums/KeyConstants.md).

returns.description: The key corresponding to the given scancode, or "unknown" if the scancode doesn't map to a KeyConstant on the current system.
returns.name: key

scancodetokey.shortDescription: Gets the key corresponding to the given hardware scancode.

textinput.shortDescription: Enables the text input, and shows the onscreen keyboard for the mobile users.

returns.name: state

Keyboard.name: Keyboard
Keyboard.shortDescription: This peripheral is responsible for handling keyboard input.

RAM.fullDescription:
Allows the creation of video memory effects.

## Memory Table:

```
0x0 -> 0x2FFF - The Video RAM
0x3000 -> 0x5FFF - The Label Image
0x6000 -> 0x15FFF - The FDD RAM
```
**Note:** The FDD RAM is used by DiskOS when saving your game into a `.png`
